newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends mixed in featureless trade.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends mixed in featureless trade.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices closed mixed in continued featureless trading due to lack of direction and fresh buying, dealers said.
"The market is flat. There's no activity," one dealer said, adding that there was no sign of consumers returning to the market soon.

Dealers said buyers appeared to have met most of their rubber requirements for the near term. But some buying interest could be seen after the Eid al-Fitr and Chinese Lunar New Year festivities in early February, when tapping stopped for nearly a week and put a strain on supply of latex to the market.

At the close, February RSS1 buyer was quoted at 304 cents ($1.23) a kg by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board, up half cent from Thursday. February SMR 20 buyer was down half cent at 299.50 cents ($1.21) a kg.
Traders offered the SMR 20 at 300 cents, SMR CV at 364, SMR L at 344, SMR 5 at 313, SMR 10 at 301 and drum latex FOB at 237.
The INRO five-day moving average was 235.38 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Jan 16 against 236.08 on Jan 15. The daily indicator price was 234.73 versus 234.90.
